action.action-desc: Mr. Wittman (for himself, Mr. Gallagher, Mr. Byrne, Mr. Franks of Arizona, Ms. Cheney, Mr. Banks of Indiana, Mr. Shuster, Ms. Hanabusa, and Ms. Shea-Porter) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Armed Services

form.official-title: To state the policy of the United States on the minimum number of available battle force ships.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Securing the Homeland by Increasing our Power on the Seas Act or the SHIPS Act.

section.header: Policy of the United States on minimum number of battle force ships
section.text: It shall be the policy of the United States to have available, as soon as practicable, not fewer than 355 battle force ships, comprised of the optimal mix of platforms, with funding subject to the annual authorization of appropriation and the annual appropriation of funds.
